subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] New Guy
msgSnippet: Have you found the original manual on the web.  It s about the best (only) way to understand the system. I think it s in the archive of the read alphabet group
messageBody:
Re: [Read_Alphabet] New Guy
Have you found the original manual on the web.  It's about the best
(only) way to understand the system. I think it's in the archive of
the read alphabet group at yahoo

I had trouble downloading it, but someone sent it directly to me, and
I could send it to you if you want. Its' PPDF format.

You shouldn't worry about the linkages too much at first - there's
lot to learn first.

PS: I started in Shavian, but am now a QS convert.  Shavian looks
like Klingon to me now, and while it is good for printed matter, it
is no fun to write by hand.  You should enjoy the fluidity that QS
offers.

--
- /bob /mk/brMm
   /wUdstak  /nV /jDk

"wun simpol iz az gUd Az anuHD prOvFdid
  evrIwun atacez H sEm mIniN tM it."
>                    - /JPJ /bxnRd /SY













Hi all.  I just found out about the Shavian and the Read Alphabet,
and I was wondering how exactly the letters of Quickscript join...
how one goes about writing it.  I know that's probably a stupid
question, and you've probably already covered this territory before,
but I would greatly appreciate it if anyone could give me some links
on learning it.

tribal misfit
